system.description:
Craft (INT)

You are skilled at making various objects and substances. This skill encompasses several categories, each of them treated as a separate skill: Chemical, Electronics, Mechanical, Pharmaceutical, Structural, Visual Arts, and Writing.

Craft skills are specifically focused on creating objects. To use a Craft skill effectively, a character must have a kit or some other set of basic tools. The WP cost of this equipment varies according to the particular Craft skill.

To use Craft, first decide what the character is trying to make and consult the category descriptions below. If the character has enough WP to purchase the raw materials, make the Craft check against the given TN for the object in question. If the character fails the check, they do not make the object, and the raw materials are wasted (unless otherwise noted).

Generally, a character may take 10, when using a Craft skill to construct an object. A character may take 10 on a repair check or accomplish a jury-rig repair. Multiple attempts may be attempted, stacking on the previous attempt, each time using the same amount of raw materials each time, taking the same amount of time and adding each subsequent roll together, until the TN is achieved or the character chooses to stop.

The character may try as many times as they like, as long as they can afford the raw materials cost for each attempt.

Craft (Alchemy) Trained Only

This skill allows a character to mix alchemical components to create acids and bases, and potions to both consume and use as weapons.
The Craft (Alchemy) skill is a focused skill for any character that has Craft (Chemical) or Craft (Pharmaceutical) as a focused skill.

Acids and Bases

See @UUID[Compendium.opsandtactics.core-rulebook.Item.l4CP8lX7ZuwEKsWd]{Craft (Chemical)}

Magecraft Inks

Spell inks are inks that are crafted from natural materials and allow a mage to bring out the most in their spells. They grant bonus SP for their selected spell schools, and do not require the skill points, nor do they go towards the total spell points spent per spell, or per day, however when used with a different school, instead provide penalties for any other school, which count against the maximum spell points per spell when used. 1 unit of ink is enough to scribe 80 spells or refill a fountain pen eight times.

Formatting ink is a brightly colored, fluorescent and chemiluminescent ink that is used in the creation of formatted paper. It is brightly colored to make it clear even at a glance, even under black-light or in the dark. 1 unit of ink is enough to format 120 sheets of paper.

Psionic Incense

Incense is is aromatic biotic material that releases fragrant smoke when burnt, used to enhance psionic abilities.

Potion Slurry

A potion slurry is the base liquid for all potions. It does nothing on its own, but must be created in order for an alchemist to impart effects onto. It takes 1 unit of potion slurry to make a single potion.
Base Potion Slurry
A base potion slurry is the standard potion slurry. All effects that are imparted on this slurry last for 2 rounds.

Powerful Potion Slurry
This potion slurry sacrifices the time the potion lasts, but greatly increases the potency. All effects only last for 1 round, but the effects are multiplied by 3. Any effects that can not have their potency increased are not affected by the improvement. Any effect that uses dice has those dice multiplied. Any effect that would hit the maximum limit due to this slurry is instead capped at the maximum limit.

Metered Potion Slurry
This potion slurry sacrifices the potency of a potion, but instead gains a much longer effect. All effects last for 6 rounds, but the potency of the effects are divided in half, rounded up. Any effects that can not be reduced are not affected by the reduction. Any effect that uses dice has those dice halved, rounded up, to a minimum of 1.

Adding Effects to Potions

After an alchemist has created a potion slurry they may then add effects to the potion slurry to create a potion. Effects come in two flavors, Harmful and Helpful. Alchemist often add flavors and food coloring to the potions to make them more palatable and to distinguish them at a glance, as well as to market them. In order to impart a potion slurry with an effect, the character makes a Craft (Alchemy) check [TN10 + Effects TN] The raw material wealth point cost is only to include that specific effect in the potion. It does not increase with the potency.

Storing Potions

Due to their tendency to eat through plastics and synthetic containers, potions must be stored in glass or metal bottles, vials, foil globes, or some kind of non-reactive container. They have no shelf life and theoretically can last forever.

Harmful Effects

Harmful effects cause damage or a penalty, either through consumption, or contact. Multiple effects may be combined in a single potion.

Elemental Damage The crafter selects fire, cold, electrical, concussion, or acid damage. This effect adds a single d6 of the selected damage to the potion per increase. The target takes this damage every round, for the potion’s duration. This has a maximum of 12d6.

Bestow Blindness This effect magically blinds the character for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Muteness This effect magically mutes the character for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Curse The crafter selects STR, DEX, or CON. This effect magically reduces the selected ability score for the penalty amount, for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Weakness The crafter selects fire, cold, electrical, concussion, or acid damage. This effect causes the target to become weak to the selected damage. When the target is attacked with the same damage that they have a weakness to, the damage receives a +1 bonus for every point in weakness the target has. This effect last for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Vulnerability The crafter selects bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage. This effect causes the target to become vulnerable to the selected damage. When the target is attacked with the same damage that they have a vulnerability to, the damage receives a +1 bonus for every point in vulnerability the target has. This effect last for the potion’s duration.

Helpful Effects
Helpful effects heal damage or provide protection, either through consumption, or contact. Multiple effects may be combined in a single potion.

Light Healing This effect adds a single d4 of XHP healing to the potion per increase. The target heals this damage every round, for the potion’s duration. This potion only heals XHP.

Heavy Healing This effect adds a single d4 of CHP healing to the potion per increase. The target heals this damage every round, for the potion’s duration. This potion heals CHP first, and after the CHP are healed, then begins to heal XHP.

Stop Bleeding This effect removes a single bleed damage die per bonus every round, for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Elemental Resistance The crafter selects fire, cold, electrical, concussion, or acid damage. This effect causes the target to become resistant to the selected damage. When the target is attacked with the same damage that they have a resistance to, the damage is reduced for every point in resistance the target has. This effect lasts for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Damage Reduction The crafter selects bludgeoning, slashing, piercing or non-lethal damage. This effect causes the target to gain Damage Reduction to the selected damage. When the target is attacked with the same damage that they have a Damage Reduction to, the damage is reduced for every point in Damage Reduction the target has. This effect lasts for the potion’s duration.

Bestow Mutagen The crafter selects STR, DEX, or CON. This effect magically increases the selected ability score by the bonus amount for the potion’s duration.

Special

A character without an Alchemy kit takes a -6 penalty on Craft (Alchemy) checks.
